optionalfeature.name: Spirit of the Fox
entries: This spirit emulates the deceptive magic used by sly fox spirits. While wearing a totem bound with this spirit, you have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks and Charisma (Deception) checks.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to invoke the totem and choose a different creature within 30 feet of you, other than the attacker. The chosen creature becomes the target of the attack, using the same roll. This magic can transfer the attack's effects regardless of the attack's range. Once you invoke this totem, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit of the Forest
entries: This rune's magic channels the masterful craftsmanship of great smiths. While wearing a totem bound with this spirit, you have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) checks and other checks made to forage for food or gather herbs in the wild.

In addition, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can invoke the totem to summon thorny vines. The target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} piercing damage, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition Restrained} for 1 minute. While {@condition Restrained} by the vines, the target takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, destroying the vines on a success. Once you invoke this totem, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit of the Turtle
entries: This spirit bestows a resilience reminiscent of a dragon turtle. While wearing a totem bound with this spirit, you have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance against poison damage.

In addition, you can invoke the totem as a bonus action, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. Once you invoke this totem, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Warden
entries: Rune Knights enhance their martial prowess using the supernatural power of runes, an ancient practice that originated with giants. Rune cutters can be found among any family of giants, and you likely learned your methods first or second hand from such a mystical artisan. Whether you found the giant's work carved into a hill or cave, learned of the runes from a sage, or met the giant in person, you studied the giant's craft and learned how to apply magic runes to empower your equipment.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritseeker
entries: {@i 3rd-level Spirit Warden feature}
You are attuned to the natural world, giving you a kinship with beasts.
You gain proficiency with {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB}, and you learn to speak, read, and write {@language Druidic}.

You gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature} or {@skill Animal Handling} skill, and you learn to speak, read, and write {@language Druidic}. Additionally, you can cast the {@spell Speak with Animals|xphb} spell once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Totem Carver
entries: {@i 3rd-level Spirit Warden feature}

You learn to bind primal spirits to totems, allowing you to channel their powers to aid you. You bind two spirits of your choice from the list of {@filter Primal Spirits|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=PS}. When you reach certain levels in this class, you can bind additional spirits, as shown in the Bound Spirits table. If a spirit has prerequisites, you can bind it at the same time you meet its prerequisites.
When you gain a Fighter level, you can replace one {@filter Primal Spirit|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=PS} you currently have bound with another of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Strength
entries: {@i 3rd-level Spirit Warden feature}
You have learned how to imbue yourself with the might of primal spirits. As a bonus action, you magically gain the following benefits, which last for 1 minute:

items: If you are smaller than Large, you become Large, along with anything you are wearing. If you lack the room to become Large, your size doesn't change.
You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Your attacks with melee weapons or unarmed strikes deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.
